page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area lies to the north of Halifax town centre. It comprises mainly of an upland area rising to a height of 297m. This area is covered mainly with uncultivated non_woodland vegetation_ grassland. There are the remains of many old quarries which were used for local building materials, but are now generally worked out. The vallies of Shibden and Ovenden once used fast flowing streams to work textile mills which used the wool from locally bred sheep. Today this industry has largely died out leaving only one major producer of high quality worsted yarns.
